intro: Allocarya scouleri var. hirta, commonly known as the hairy Allocarya, is a variant of the Allocarya scouleri species native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
